result.execSummary:
The defendant Promise A. Wolf was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs/fees due during the term of supervision.
- If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the governmental entities for the balance due.

- Absolute sobriety.
- AODA assessment and any follow up counseling/treatment deemed apppropriate by agent.
- Random testing.
- Submit to DNA sample by 5-28-2016 at the Ozaukee County Jail.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Promise A. Wolf

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Promise A. Wolf in court with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Counsel files plea questionnaire. State makes oral amendment to the charges and will file an amended information.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 11, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Promise A. Wolf in court with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Meyer requests one more date for disposition.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Promise A. Wolf in court with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Detective Chad Eibs sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Whitworth, crossexam by Atty. Mayer, exam by Court. State rests. Atty. Mayer moves to dismiss. Court finds probable cause and binds case over for trial. State files information. Defense waives reading and enters not guilty plea. Bail to continue.  Further proceedings scheduled for March 24, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Motion for discovery and inspection of defendant

Defendant Promise A. Wolf in court with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant requests preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

w/condition:  Def to submit to booking, no contact with victim, absolute sobriety,  no controlled substances or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Promise A. Wolf in court.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of complaint/penalties thereof. Defendant states she is not eligible for the public defender, requests court appointed counsel. Court denies request, will not appoint counsel. Defendant stated she will attempt to retain counsel. Court finds good cause for not scheduling preliminary hearing. Court orders $1000 signature bond w/condition.  Status hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 08:45 am.
